Package prescription.tracker.medication

Class MedicationService

java.lang.Object
prescription.tracker.medication.MedicationService
@Service public class MedicationService extends Object
Service class responsible for managing medication data in the MedTrack application. It provides methods to add, retrieve, delete, and update medication information.
Author:
josemarin

  • Method Details

    • addMedication

      public void addMedication(Medication medication)
      Adds a new medication to the system.
      Parameters:
      medication - The medication to be added.
      Throws:
      DuplicateMedicationException - if a medication with the same ID already exists.

    • getMedication

      public Medication getMedication(Long medId)
      Retrieves medication details by its unique ID.
      Parameters:
      medId - The unique ID of the medication to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The retrieved medication.
      Throws:
      MedicationNotFoundException - if the medication with the specified ID is not found.

    • getUserMedication

      public List<Medication> getUserMedication(Long userId)
      Retrieves a list of medications associated with a specific user by their user ID.
      Parameters:
      userId - The unique identifier of the user whose medications are to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      A list of medications associated with the specified user.
      Throws:
      MedicationNotFoundException - If no medications are found for the given user ID.

    • deleteMedication

      public Medication deleteMedication(Long medId)
      Deletes a medication by its ID.
      Parameters:
      medId - The unique ID of the medication to delete.
      Returns:
      The deleted medication.
      Throws:
      MedicationNotFoundException - if the medication with the specified ID is not found.

    • updateMedication

      public Medication updateMedication(Medication medication)
      Updates an existing medication.
      Parameters:
      medication - The updated medication details.
      Returns:
      The updated medication.
      Throws:
      MedicationNotFoundException - if the medication with the specified ID is not found.
